result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Niehusen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges (including DNA) by 02-22-16. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence with credit for (0) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas R Niehusen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas R Niehusen in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Nicholas R Niehusen in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence with credit for (0) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.         
Court ordered defendant pay all costs and surcharges by 2-22-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered defendant pay mandatory $200.00 DNA Surcharge by 2-22-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk jks

Attorney Mark A. Dluzak in court, defendant Nicholas R Niehusen not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas R Niehusen not in court, defendant in custody, Not produced.  Attorney of record, Mark Dluzak did not appear.  Attorney Cimpl-Wiemer appeared for Attorney Dluzak.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46.  New date has been forwarded to Attorney Dluzak. jks
 Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Nicholas R Niehusen not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY PICK N' SAVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Nicholas R Niehusen in court with attorney Mark A. Dluzak.  Defendant Nicholas R Niehusen in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
